description.raw:
In this PR I address [CLOUD-164](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-164).

The Iron Data Table element, whenever a row is clicked, fires a "selecting item" event. When this happens, we open the configuration dialog.

A click on a row toggles the selection, so the event doesn't fires when it's being deselected. As no visual feedback is provided for the selection, this might be misleading: The row is clicked but the dialog doesn't shows up.

As no other event lets us change this behavior, we can prevent this by clearing the selection of the row every time one is selected. This causes clicks to always fire the data table's `on-selecting-item` event.

With the callback of this event, we need to call a `setTimeout`, to let the dialog render as desired.

ptal @andres_fortier

Notice that the change is repeated through Keys, Machine Types and User Metrics elements.
